Description:
The FHIR Observation Social History $lastn interaction returns a patient's living situation.

Living situation observations correspond to living arrangement categories in Epic, which are defined separately by each Epic organization. Work with the organization to determine supported values if you plan to exchange living situation data through FHIR.

This web service returns at most only a single living situation observation for a patient. Historical values are not available in Epic.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Use "social-history" to search for living situation observations.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
Use the following SNOMED code to search for living situation:

  • 365508006: Living situation

max.Name: max
max.Description: The maximum amount of responses for each subtype of the category.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The reference to a patient resource.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
Use the following SNOMED code to search for living situation:

  • 365508006: Living situation

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description: Living situation has no default SNOMED code mapping.
